Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: 1 hour colloquium, no work outside of classroom
1.5 hours
Approximately 1 hour per week over the course of the semester.
0hrs. weekly, mandatory seminar attendance for credit.

- Great course
- Layout of room difficult for all attendees to see/hear lecturer
Really good speakers.

This seminar is the highlight of my week!! I love being together with my classmates learning from impressive industry leaders. Speakers are interesting and engaging - I have loved them all! I can't wait to continue to learn in the spring!
nice!
Great speakers for the most part - maybe firmer groundrules for students and their use of phones/paying attention
It was great. very inspiring to see the career trajectories of individuals in our field and learn from them.
Very good, lots of interesting speakers, great opportunity to hear from leaders in the field
Great
some of the speakers were amazing, but not all of them. I do appreciate the dinners and food during the talk

great speakers from diverse backgrounds
always looked forward to thursday evenings

This is a good course. I appreciate the diversity of the speakers. 

The only downside is that a select few of the speakers were not prepared to give their story.
Fantastic course with incredible speakers!
Non-traditional class.  Consists of guest lecturers on a weekly basis.  No coursework required other than a final paper.
Strengths + Weaknesses: Hit or miss with speaker selection. If good, good. If not as good, boring.
I liked the seminar style of the class as it invited students to actively participate in the class discussions.

Great and candid insight into the thinking behind many healthcare leaders. It would be great if it Wednesday instead of Thursday, since it conflicts with SOM activities (e.g. Closing Bell) but understand if the scheduling is needed for the prominent speakers brought to campus.
The topics are absorbing, speakers are big-named and insightful. The course is rather good.

Loved the conversations with giants in the HCM sector. While the table-style set-up seemed to suit Dr. Forman's liking, the lack of room in the class coupled with this set-up made it challenging for many students to obtain seats and/or even able to see the guest lecturer.
strength: multiple speakers who have come so far in the weekly colloquium serve as really good examples to pursue careers
Great assembly of healthcare speakers and opportunity to connect over small dinners; relevant or suggested readings by each speaker would be awesome

I love colloquium. I wish more of our classes were in this small group seminar format. This is one of the few courses I took this semester that truly inspired me and reminded me why I'm doing this degree in the first place.

- Prof. Forman does a great job introducing speakers and guiding the conversation
- Some lecturers did not seem particularly prepared to give a meaningful lecture/presentation
Really good with the speakers and taking the conversation to interesting points.
Adore Professor Forman!
nice!
He was great. I think he did a great job of selecting relevant and inspiring leaders.
Very good, good at guiding speakers to interesting topics
Great
I appreciate the work he put in for the course
Howie is a great facilitator. He created a welcoming and light-hearted environment that enabled others to ask good and varied questions.
Professor Forman did a great job facilitating this course.
Howie's connections are tremendous and this leads to a great lineup of guest speakers.

Strengths: Amazing network of contacts. 
Weaknesses: Build more of an arc across the selected speakers. Have themes across segments of speakers. Facilitate the discussion more along the lines of those pre-selected themes (vs. sometimes just letting the speaker talk about random things). This might give students more of a connection to the course as a whole.
Dr. Forman is extremely knowledgable and enthusiastic about the course.
Howie is amazing and drives healthcare at Yale.. couldn't imagine anyone doing it better.
Howard has lots of experience in this area and MD-MBA training style is pioneer and essential in the current era. I would like to investigate more opportunities in this area.
Goes above and beyond to invite world class guest speakers who are top 50 in their respective fields.
really thought provoking remarks from prof facilitates the colloquium very well
Howie is great at warming up the room and engaging with the speaker and students to create a great seminar environment.
Highly recommend - great for getting current insight into topics in healthcare and networking opportunities

Good course to see real experiences in the field.
It is quite late regarding time. (6.30 on the afternoon)
Look forward to this series! So excellent!
nice! to know what's happening in real healthcare
Great speakers for healthcare issues
Yes, would recommend. I always felt inspired after every colloquium and would want other students to experience that too.
very good, would recommend if interested in healthcare leadership/future of healthcare systems
Great class
Interesting to hear from people in healthcare leadership
must take course!
I would recommend. This course was helpful in understanding the healthcare industry.
Always looked forward to attending colloquium each week. The ability to go to dinner with the speakers afterward is a fantastic aspect of the course too!
I would recommend this course.  It is a nice "change-up" to traditional lecture.  Also a great networking opportunity to connect with many of the speakers before/after the weekly meetings.

A 2x/month speaker series in which you hear from stakeholders across the healthcare space. Speakers have been hit or miss, but generally hearing the stories of high-profile leaders is a fantastic learning experience. The timing is challenging (EOW, Thurs evenings, conflicts with SOM Closing Bell).

I would recommend this course to anyone interesting in pursing a career in health care industry. The broad range of speakers will provide students with the different career options they will have in the future.
Great and candid insight into the thinking behind many healthcare leaders!
Recommended.

Yes  

 Provides excellent and  tremendously  sought after opportunity to learn from real life stories of top experts and executives in the field.
yes
Great chance to meet and hear from a wide variety of healthcare professionals
Extremely valuable opportunity to ground yourself in why it matters that we're studying public health and network with amazing professionals.
